main.name: José Ramón Martínez Riveiro
main.description: Software Engineer. MSc in Computer Science
main.bio: I'm José, a software engineer with 4+ years of professional experience and a strong academic background, holding both a Bachelor's and a Master's degree in Computer Science. I've taught Software Systems Quality as a professor, conducted research at UCLM, and spoken at several technical conferences. Currently, I focus on enhancing the performance and usability of public sector systems.

work.title: Software Engineer II
work.description: • Centralized authentication system for the Ministry of Agriculture of JCCM, based on OAuth 2.0, audited annually, integrated into over 60 applications, and used by more than 20,000 monthly unique users. • System for managing scheduled ETLs, supporting over 30 simultaneous executions. • Coordination of development, deployment, and production launch of four products.

work.title: Software Engineer I
work.description: • Architectural design for new projects based on Hexagonal principles and Domain-Driven Design (DDD). • Onboarding and mentoring process for new employees. • Report generator for aid and subsidy applications in the Agriculture sector. • Product for the management of agri-food industries.

work.title: Substitute professor
work.description: • Substitute professor for Software Systems Quality in the University Degree of Computer Science at University of Castilla-La Mancha.

work.title: Researcher/Research support staff
work.description: • Research in interactive systems, enhancing the recommendation system for breast cancer patients using audio and images • Article: https://doi.org/10.1177/15691861231206489.

work.title: Research Fellow | Software Engineer
work.description: • System to improve the quality of life for breast cancer patients. • Content management system for educational materials within the context of the European project LanGuide.

work.title: Software Developer Intern
work.description: • Developed a web-based monitoring app using domestic sensors.
